title: Three more useful apps
body: <p>The <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/articles/useful_software.aspx#VLC">first</a> is <a href="http://videolan.org/vlc/">VLC DVD Player</a>.  Free (speech and beer), open source, and cross platform.  I heard about it from <a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/cyrusn/archive/2004/07/11/179870.aspx">this dude's blog</a></p><p>The <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/articles/useful_software.aspx#PowerMenu">second</a> is <a href="http://www.veridicus.com/tummy/programming/powermenu/">PowerMenu</a>.  It lets you set the transparency and priority from the context menu in the taskbar.</p><p>The <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/articles/useful_software.aspx#whoami">third</a> is <a href="http://www.kewlit.com/whoami/index.html">Whoami</a>.  Basically it's just a small app that writes your machine's info onto the wallpaper.  This is pretty much only useful if you have multiple machines and you forget which one you're on.  I heard these two from <a href="http://www.hanselman.com/blog/content/radiostories/2003/09/09/scottHanselmansUltimateDeveloperAndPowerUsersToolsList.html" title="Scott Hanselman">Scott Hanselman</a>.</p><p>(in case you haven't noticed, I have a <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/articles/useful_software.aspx" title="Big List of Useful Software Apps">big list of useful apps</a>)</p>
